statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.headline: Utah State 65, Oral Roberts 64
article.story: LOGAN, Utah (AP) -- David Pak dropped in two free throws with 4.4 seconds remaining to push Utah State University to a 65-64 win over Oral Roberts Tuesday night. Jaycee Carroll scored 17 points, 15 of them in the second half, for the Aggies (5-3) to go along with 16 from Pak. The Golden Eagles (5-5) were led by Ken Tutt with 29 points and Caleb Green with 14. ORU took its first lead of the game at 64-63 with 25 seconds remaining on a 3-pointer by Tutt, his fourth 3-pointer in the game's final four minutes. ORU's Eric Fowlkes missed a free throw after USU was unable to score. Scrambling for a final shot, Pak was fouled and dropped in his only free throw attempts of the game. Tutt scored 21 of his 29 points in the second half, shooting 7-of-12 from beyond the 3-point arc. Trailing by as many as 18 points in the first half, the Golden Eagles got to 48-46 with 7:30 remaining when Green wrestled up an inside shot. USU countered with a 3-foot jumper by Carroll and then the teams traded baskets the rest of the way until the game's final hectic moment. In the first half, USU ran out to a quick 19-5 lead, keyed by three 3-pointers and a fast break tip-in by Pak. Both teams started off the game shooting poorly, though USU ended the first half shooting 44 percent, compared to ORU's 23 percent, and taking a 36-20 lead at halftime.
